p: “Population control of Ae. aegypti mosquitoes using insecticides has been a mainstay of vector-borne disease control methods for decades but is undermined by widespread insecticide resistance. A promising innovative strategy, based on a bacterium called Wolbachia pipientis, has been trialed in many countries. Wolbachia is a maternally transmitted bacterial endosymbiont and is naturally present in at least 40% of all insect species 14 .”
